newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Traders see India's Jan diesel imports to top Dec.
newsitem.headline: Traders see India's Jan diesel imports to top Dec.

text.p: State-owned Indian Oil Corp (IOC) is expected to buy more high speed diesel in its tender for January deliveries, over the 520,000 tonnes it purchased for December, traders said on Thursday.

Traders are expecting IOC to buy around 700,000 tonnes or even up to 800,000 tonnes of 0.5 and 1.0 percent sulphur diesel in this tender. However, on the low side, some traders expect IOC to buy around the same volumes as in December.
"It will provide good support to the market, and if India buys more than 700,000 tonnes, it will sustain arbitrage opportunities," one trader said.
In its last tender, IOC awarded free-on-board cargoes at 75 cents per barrel and $1.05 premiums to MidEast quotes.

Cargoes on a c-and-f basis to the west coast were awarded around $1.87-$2.08 per barrel premiums to MidEast quotes, while east coast cargoes were awarded around $2.20-$2.81 premiums to MidEast quotes c-and-f.
India cancelled its tender to import diesel for November delivery.
